text: when I asked my mother what she thought
I was going to be when I grew up she's
like a stock broker and I was like
really she's like yeah you would pull
out the pots and pans and the kitchen
when you were a little kid banging on
them and saying order Buy sell but I
think in general I was just curious
about the
world what's Happening Here how did that
happen why why is that changing what
could happen and I think curiosity
combined with just having a really good
support system around me has really been
the motivating
factors when I came to HBS I just feel
like I opened my mind to so many
different possibilities just thinking
big a lot of my family background is
either working in engineering or working
in the medical field so my father
actually did both Joseph and Sarah Ogen
wall both immigrants to America both
from Nigeria my dad worked his entire
career at Dupont my mother is actually a
nurse for me it's beyond just kind of
being a a physical role model
manifestation of saying look you can
achieve success yes that is a great
portion and we need more of that yes
more and more women in senior positions
love that but then who are you what is
the type of person that achieved success
outside of just the business aspects of
I behind it is it a person that I can
relate to is it a person that I want to
strive to be is it a person that I can
continue to learn from I want to be that
person having spent 5 years working in
San Francisco and working in Tech
specifically I think a lot of the
aspects around diversity and Tech are
just now being being explored I remember
going to an all hands meeting and I was
like I just want to see the other black
females who are working here and I
looked around and I was like I think I
am the highest ranking black female here
that was just scary because I was like
I'm not that old and I'm not in that
senior level of opposition that was kind
of like a personal light bulb moment of
okay either I need to change out of this
environment or I need to change this
environment and I've now been given
opportunities to change it I'm in this
position I'm here at HBS there are
amazing amounts of women that are
equally as inspired and we all need to
do the work and go out and progress the
society further the relationships that
I've built over just this last semester
are ones that I know that I'm going to
keep well beyond
HBS if I guess I would leave with one
you know final notion it is embracing
that sense of risk I know it sounds
cliche and people are going to be in
very different positions for that but
there will often be cases where you
should probably Embrace that risk versus
settling or staying within the status
quo
[Music]
